Please fill and submit the attached Co-op Questionnaire with your application.

A career at ICBC is an opportunity to be part of a talented, diverse and inclusive team that is driven to serve its customers and community. Make the most of your skills and take the opportunity to grow and develop your career. ICBC is an equal opportunity employer, and invites applications from all qualified candidates. You can expect a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits and a challenging work environment. Drive your career with us.


Job Title: Technical Operations and Software Platforms Co-op
Employment Type: Co-op Student
Location: North Vancouver
Hours of Work: 7.5 hr Day Shift (5 days M-F) (8 days per month or 2 days per week in office)
Pay: $34.23 per hour + 11.2% in lieu of vacation and stat
Duration: 4 months with options to renew


ICBC is searching for a motivated student who is intrigued by all things technical. Our co-op opportunity will provide practical, hands on experience in one of the largest IT shops within British Columbia. This is your opportunity to gain exposure to complex enterprise level technology and software platforms. Our teams support over 650 applications from COTS ERP systems to home-grown specialty applications.


Position highlights
We have an opportunity for a Co-op with technical interests to join one of our Technical Operations or Software Platforms team and help support our clients across the province. This team supports a number of different infrastructure and software platforms.
You will be in the centre of an operational department assisting in sustaining our platforms in support of business change. This work will help you gain experience in:

Systems administration and technical support
Incident response and resolution
Level 2 problem and root cause analysis
Scripting and automating maintenance tasks
Consulting with application development teams
Technical implementation and delivery
Analysis and automation of operational and project processes
System monitoring and enhancements

Position requirements
Experience in the following technical skills would be an asset:

Databases (SQL Server, Oracle)
Data Science (Hadoop, Python, R)
Scripting technologies (e.g., PowerShell) or programming skills (Java or .Net)
Directory services (LDAP, AD)
Windows 7/10, Windows Server 2012
Linux (RedHat)
Automation technologies (Ansible, Jenkins, SVN, SCCM)
Monitoring technologies (Splunk, Nagios, SCOM, Opnet)
Directory services (AD, LDAP) and Group Policy (GPO)
Knowledge of Hybrid Cloud Platforms and multi-site operational support (e.g. Microsoft Azure and M365)


The following basic skills will be required:

Organized and delivery focused
Good communication - written and verbal
Understanding basic business processes and IT processes and functions (e.g., network, server, databases, storage, access management, patching, etc.)
Great attention to detail
IT-related education
Self-motivated
Able to work with minimal supervision
